newsitem.title: UK: New WH Smith CEO could be Giles - paper.
newsitem.headline: New WH Smith CEO could be Giles - paper.

text.p: Alan Giles, the head of WH Smith Plc's Waterstone's book-retailing arm, has emerged as a strong contender for the post of group chief executive after the abrupt departure of Bill Cockburn, the Sunday Times newspaper said.
It said Giles, promoted to the group's main board in 1995, had last year presided over record profits at Waterstone's and had launched an ambitious expansion programmme.
Giles's main rival was Keith Hamill, the group's finance director, the paper said.
Shares in WH Smith dropped to their lowest level in 20 months on Tuesday amid negative press and analyst comment on Cockburn's planned October departure for British Telecom.
